com.rivelbop.rivelworks.g2d.physics.joint

Class JointFriction

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.rivelbop.rivelworks.g2d.physics.joint.JointBase
      • com.rivelbop.rivelworks.g2d.physics.joint.JointFriction

  • public class JointFriction
extends JointBase
    Friction Joint, is used for top-down friction. It provides 2D translational friction and angular friction.
    Author:
    David/Philip Jerzak (RivelBop)

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class com.rivelbop.rivelworks.g2d.physics.joint.JointBase

        definition, joint

      Creates a friction joint without an anchor point.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JointFriction

        public JointFriction(com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.World world,
                     com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body bodyA,
                     com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Body bodyB,
                     float x,
                     float y,
                     float maxForce,
                     float maxTorque,
                     boolean collideConnected)
        Creates a friction joint with the specified anchor point.
        Parameters:
        world - The world to add the joint to.
        bodyA - The first body to connect.
        bodyB - The second body to connect.
        x - The x-coordinate of the anchor point.
        y - The y-coordinate of the anchor point.
        maxForce - The maximum friction force in Newtons.
        maxTorque - The maximum torque friction in N-m.
        collideConnected - Enable/disable collisions between the two bodies.

        Creates a friction joint with the specified anchor point, takes in the wrapped physics bodies instead of the LibGDX defaults.

        bodyA - The first body to connect.
        bodyB - The second body to connect.
        x - The x-coordinate of the anchor point.
        y - The y-coordinate of the anchor point.
        maxForce - The maximum friction force in Newtons.
        maxTorque - The maximum torque friction in N-m.
        collideConnected - Enable/disable collisions between the two bodies.
